intro: Euphorbia riinae, commonly known as the Riina's spurge, is a succulent plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its thick, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. It is adapted to arid environments and stores water in its stems to survive dry conditions. Euphorbia riinae is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and drought tolerance.
